meanings.definition: A device used to catch animals
meanings.sent1: The hunter set up a trap to catch the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The mouse got caught in the trap while looking for food.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon outsmarted the trap and escaped with the bait.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a trap, luring him in with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The trap snapped shut, capturing the unsuspecting squirrel.

meanings.definition: A situation in which someone is tricked or deceived
meanings.sent1: She fell into the trap of believing everything she read online.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist set a trap to steal people's money.
meanings.sent3: His friends played a harmless prank, creating a funny trap for him.
meanings.sent4: The trap of jealousy can lead to destructive behavior.
meanings.sent5: The trap of procrastination can hinder your success.

meanings.definition: To catch someone in a trap
meanings.sent1: The detective managed to trap the thief in the alley.
meanings.sent2: She tried to trap the butterfly gently without harming it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally trapped himself in the room with no way out.
meanings.sent4: The spider quickly trapped the fly in its web.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox managed to trap the hunter in his own game.

meanings.definition: To set a trap for someone
meanings.sent1: The spy carefully set a trap to catch the enemy agent.
meanings.sent2: She decided to trap her brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The kids planned to trap their teacher with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: He set a clever trap to catch the pesky raccoons in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The cunning villain plotted to trap the hero in a dangerous situation.
